definition-item.definition-title: CONTAINERS FOR STORAGE OR TRANSPORT OF ARTICLES OR MATERIALS, e.g. BAGS, BARRELS, BOTTLES, BOXES, CANS, CARTONS, CRATES, DRUMS, JARS, TANKS, HOPPERS, FORWARDING CONTAINERS; ACCESSORIES, CLOSURES, OR FITTINGS THEREFOR; PACKAGING ELEMENTS; PACKAGES

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: Containers, packaging elements or packages with auxiliary means or provisions for displaying articles or materials;

Methods of packaging which are wholly characterised by the form of the package produced or the form of the container or packaging element used, as distinct from the operations performed or the apparatus employed, which are covered by subclass B65B.

In this subclass, groups B65D5/00, B65D27/00, B65D29/00, B65D31/00 or B65D65/00 include constructional features of foldable or erectable container or wrapper blanks as well as the containers or wrappers formed by folding or erecting such blanks.
Containers, packaging elements or packages classified in group B65D85/00, are also classified according to the constructional or functional features, if such features are of interest.

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: containers specially adapted for storing agricultural or horticultural products
containers specially adapted for use in dairies
travelling bags or baskets, suitcases
travelling or camp equipment
linkable display containers
household or table equipment
letter-boxes for home use
kitchen equipment
associated with vehicles
machines, apparatus, or devices for, or methods of, packaging articles or materials
sack holders
refuse receptacles
handling sheets, webs or filamentary material
load-engaging elements or devices attached to lifting or lowering gear of cranes or adapted for connection therewith for transmitting lifting forces
liquid handling
storing gases

section-body.paragraph-text: The following orthogonal Indexing Codes are obligatory and applied to documents in B65D1/00 - B65D85/84 groups, however only if not covered by another Invention Information group, i.e. any of the B65D1/00 - B65D85/84 groups takes precedence.
B65D2401/00 - tamper indicating means, the following subgroups take precedence: B65D41/32, B65D43/0235, B65D51/20, B65D55/02
B65D2201/00 - general orthogonal codes, may be used in B65D1/00 - B65D85/84 groups
B65D2301/00 - general orthogonal codes, may be used in B65D1/00 - B65D85/84 groups.
The following orthogonal codes are obligatory and are used only with the group(s) they relate to:
B65D2501/00 - bottles, B65D1/02 groups
B65D2501/24 - bottle crates, B65D1/24 groups
B65D2517/00 - cans, beverage cans, B65D17/00 groups
B65D2519/00 - pallets, B65D19/00 & sub-groups
B65D2525/00 - details of rigid or semi-rigid containers, e.g. handles, B65D25/00 groups
B65D2539/00 - corks, stoppers, B65D39/00 groups
B65D2543/00 - lids, covers, B65D43/00 groups
B65D2547/00 - closures with filling or discharging devices, e.g. pour spouts, B65D47/00 groups
B65D2555/00 - accessories for closures, B65D55/00 groups
B65D2563/00 - straps, e.g. for bundling, B65D63/00 groups
B65D2565/00 - special materials, e.g. recyclable or recycled, B65D65/00 groups
B65D2571/00 - pallettisable loads, bundling wrappers or trays , B65D71/00 groups
B65D2575/00 - packages comprising articles enclosed between sheets or blanks, B65D75/00 groups
B65D2577/00 - container within a container; container closures formed after filling, B65D77/00 groups
B65D2581/00 - corner or edge protectors; microwave heating packages, B65D81/00 groups
B65D2583/00 - containers or packages with means for dispensing; pill dispensers, B65D83/00 groups
B65D2585/00 - pizza boxes; contact lenses containers for bulky articles; containers for machines, engines, or vehicles , B65D85/00 groups
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Rigid or semi-rigid containers
Containers not deformed by, or not taking-up the shape of, their contents; Containers adapted to be temporarily deformed to expel their contents; Pallets; Trays.
Flexible containers
Containers deformed by, or taking-up the shape of, their contents; Containers adapted to be permanently deformed to expel their contents.
Packaging elements

Elements, other than containers, for covering, protecting, stiffening, or holding together articles or materials to be stored or transported; Packaging materials of special type or form not provided for in other subclasses.
Packages
Combination of containers or packaging elements with articles or materials to be stored or transported: Articles joined together for convenience of storage or transport.
Paper
Includes materials, e.g. cardboard, plastic sheet materials, laminated materials, or metal foils, worked in a manner analogous to paper.
Large containers
Containers having about the size of containers used in container traffic, sometimes referred to as freight, forwarding or "ISO" (International Standardization) containers, or larger containers.

definition-item.definition-title: Rigid or semi-rigid containers having bodies formed in one piece, e.g. by casting metallic material, by moulding plastics, by blowing vitreous material, by throwing ceramic material, by moulding pulped fibrous material or by deep-drawing operations performed on sheet material (with curved or partially-curved cross-section made by winding or bending paper B65D3/00; with polygonal cross-section formed by folding B65D5/00; specially constructed to be opened by cutting, piercing or tearing of wall portions B65D17/00; rigid pallets with side walls B65D19/02)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Rigid or semi-rigid containers having bodies or peripheral walls of curved or partially-curved cross-section made by winding or bending paper without folding along defined lines
Rigid or semi-rigid containers of polygonal cross-section, e.g. boxes, cartons or trays, formed by folding or erecting one or more blanks made of paper
Rigid or semi-rigid containers specially constructed to be opened by cutting or piercing or by tearing of frangible members or portions
Rigid pallets with side walls, e.g. box pallets

definition-item.definition-title: Containers or packages with special means for dispensing contents (dispensing means incorporated in closures B65D47/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Closures with filling and discharging, or with discharging devices

section-body.paragraph-text: Examples of places where the subject matter of this place is covered when specially adapted, used for a particular purpose, or incorporated in a larger system:

table-column.paragraph-text: Casings wherein movement of the lipstick or like solid is a screwing movement
Containers with arrangements for dispensing articles for shops, stores, offices, bars or the like
Dispensers for nested articles from the top
Dispensers for nested articles from the bottom
Showcases or show cabinets with dispensing arrangements
Packages or dispensers for surgical gloves
Containers specially adapted for packaging, protecting, dispensing, collecting or disposing of surgical diagnostic appliances or instruments
Packages or dispensers for prostheses
Packages or dispensers for intraocular lenses
Dispensing containers for dressings or bandages
Magazines for feeding screws or nuts in combination with spanners, wrenches or screwdrivers
Nail dispensers
Ink cartridges
Handling of sheets, webs or filamentary material
Coin deliverers
Coin-freed apparatus for dispensing discrete articles

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Containers having means for evaporating the content, e.g. deodorant, insecticide

section-body.paragraph-text: The use of available Indexing Codes is mandatory.

definition-item.definition-title: for dispensing powdered or granular material

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this place.
Figure 1 illustrates a powdery or granular material (16) dispensed from a flexible-type container, e.g. a sugar pouch.
Figure 2 illustrates a powdery or granular material dispensed from a rigid-type container, e.g. a bottle.
Examples of places where the subject matter of this place is covered when specially adapted, used for a particular purpose, or incorporated in a larger system:

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Racks for dispensing granulated or powdered materials, e.g. for shops, storehouses, bars, restaurants or the like

Measuring apparatus for volume of fluent solid material
Apparatus with reciprocating measuring chambers for fluent solid material

section-body.paragraph-text: B65D83/06 is generally allocated to a particular type of flexible or rigid-type of container which has the ability to dispense granular material. However, the overall construction of the container and its details are more important, the fact that the container can dispense granular material is additional information useful for searching. B65D83/06 should preferably not be used by itself, always with another B65D group.

definition-item.definition-title: Containers for dispensing liquid or semi-liquid contents by internal gaseous pressure, i.e. aerosol containers comprising propellant

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Containers comprising a dispensing valve fitted to the container body, actuating means and optionally a dispensing nozzle carried by a dispensing head for dispensing pressurised contents.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Spraying devices for the destruction of noxious animals or plants
Sprayers for therapeutic purposes
Spraying apparatus with a container for discharging contents from two or more sources
Portable spraying apparatus for discharging contents without mixing with gas or vapour
Spraying apparatuses with a container for discharging contents by pumping
Removing gases or liquids enclosed in discarded aerosol cans
Aerosol compositions, e.g. propellants
Devices for forming markings on finished paving in situ by spraying
Pumping of fluid by direct contact of another fluid or by using inertia of fluid to be pumped; Siphons
Fluid-delivery valves in general
Mechanical actuating means for valves comprising a movable discharge-nozzle
Vessels for containing or storing compressed, liquefied or solidified gases

Air fresheners
Sterilising materials

Lubricants

definition-item.definition-title: with tamper-indicating means, e.g. located in front of nozzle outlets (tamper-indicating means obstructing initial actuation B65D83/224)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Aerosol containers provided with tamper indicating means that show unauthorized opening of the aerosol other than the ones obstructing initial actuation.
Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this place:

Figure 1 illustrates an example of a warranty link in the form of a strip (7) having its upper end secured to cap (5), by means of thin skin (8) forming a breakable link or tearing line, whereas its lower edge has a projection (9) preventing assembly (5, 7) from separating from aerosol can (3), the removal of cap (5) being possible only after the tearing-off of warranty strip (7), which requires that tearable link (8) be broken.

Figure 2 illustrates an aerosol container (9) enclosing material that can be dispensed by pulling away portion (9) of actuator cap (1) breaking extensions (10), thus clearing the outlet orifice of portion (14) and by operating actuator (11).
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Tamper-indicating means obstructing initial actuation

definition-item.definition-title: Actuating means

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Containers for dispensing liquid or semi-liquid contents by internal gaseous pressure, i.e. aerosol containers comprising propellant
Actuation occurring by moving the aerosol container relative to the outer shell or external container
Metering valves and valve assembles where the metering is occurring at least partially in the actuating means
Marking apparatus with wheeled frame, marking material being supplied in aerosol containers

definition-item.definition-title: {Push button actuators (B65D83/204 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:
The Figure illustrates a valve stem (32) which can be depressed by actuating a push-button (46).
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Actuator caps comprising push button actuators

definition-item.definition-title: {Actuators comprising a manually operated valve and being attachable to the aerosol container, e.g. downstream a valve fitted to the container; Actuators associated to container valves with valve seats located outside the aerosol container}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this place:
Figure 1 illustrates a push-button (9) which actuates a needle valve (7) located downstream of an aerosol container valve (4).
Figure 2 illustrates an aerosol container valve (36) which is actuated by a handle (40) located outside container body (10).
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Actuators connected to the aerosol container by a flexible tube
Portable two-source spraying apparatus comprising pressurised supply containers
Portable single-source spraying apparatus comprising pressurised supply containers
Manually actuated controlling means for spraying apparatus

definition-item.definition-title: Hand lever actuators (attached to actuator caps B65D83/206)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Hand levers fitted to the container body for actuating the valve.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Hand lever actuators attached to actuator caps

definition-item.definition-title: combined with hand grips

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Hand grips fitted to the container body and provided with hand levers for actuating the valve.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:
The Figure illustrates hand grip (12) provided with lever (14) actuating the valve of the aerosol container (2).
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Hand-held or body-worn self-defence devices using repellent gases or chemicals

definition-item.definition-title: at the end of extension rods

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Extension rods and hand grips provided with hand levers for actuating the valve.
Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this place:
Figure 1 illustrates a pole for use in supporting an aerosol spray container used to exterminate insects, e.g wasps.
Figure 2 illustrates marking device (100) having a shaft (110) and an aerosol spray container (122) for dispensing a marking substance (134) on the ground, e.g. for road marking.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Setting-out line markings on playing courts
Marking-out on finished paving by spraying from aerosol containers

definition-item.definition-title: Actuator caps

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:
The Figure illustrates a cap (14) provided with an actuator (24) that, when deformed by a user, actuates the tilt valve (8).

definition-item.definition-title: {comprising push button actuators}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Caps fitted to the container body and provided with means for actuating the valve, i.e. a push button actuator.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Caps in general
Actuators formed as a rigid elongate spout

definition-item.definition-title: comprising cantilevered actuating elements, e.g. levers pivoting about living hinges

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Caps provided with cantilevered means actuating the valve.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:
The Figure illustrates cap (4) provided with lever (9) pivoting about living hinge (15) for actuating the valve (3) fitted to the aerosol container body (2).

definition-item.definition-title: with means to disable actuation (closures with means for discouraging unauthorized opening or removal thereof B65D50/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Means for disabling actuation of the valve to prevent its unintended actuation.
Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this place:

Figures 1a and 1b illustrate actuator (120) in the locked position (Figure 1a) where the abutment part (81) blocks the actuator. By rotating the abutment (81), the actuator is unlocked and ready for use in the unlocked position (Figure 1b).
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Closures with means for discouraging unauthorised opening or removal thereof

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Aerosol containers with arrangements for interruption of dispensing when the container is inverted
Hand-held spraying apparatuses (without any pressure built inside the container) comprising means for locking the pump or its actuation means

section-body.paragraph-text: If an aerosol container comprises both, means for disabling actuation and means for preventing delivery, the document shall be classified in B65D83/22 and B65D83/567 even if these means are linked.

The Figure illustrates a dome actuator (10) fitted to an aerosol container (12) wherein rotation of the upper part (14) of the dome actuator raises an actuating member (22) which actuates the dispensing valve when in a fully raised position, i.e. if the upper part (14) is rotated enough. Pressure on the actuating member (22) in a partially raised position will tend to lower it to its flush position with the top panel (24) and thereby will not actuate the dispensing valve. This aspect is classified in B65D83/567 since delivery is prevented and actuating is not disabled.
The fact that the actuator in the retracted position is immovable, i.e. locked is classified in B65D83/22.

definition-item.definition-title: Actuator locking means that are automatically engaged after each actuation

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Means that are automatically engaged after each actuation for disabling actuation of the valve.
Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this place:

Figure 1a shows an exploded top perspective view of the components of a valve locking device. Figure 1b shows the different states of the actuator locking means where a locking member (26) is aligned in an unlocked state (B) by the user in order to actuate the actuator head (46) and dispense the material when in the actuated state (C). When the actuator head is disengaged the locking member returns to its locked state (A) due to springs (18a, 18b) as shown in Figure 1a.

The Figure illustrates tamper evident device (42) which is originally positioned between casing (44) of actuator cap (10) and actuating lever (14).

definition-item.definition-title: Metering valves; Metering devices

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Metering valves and metering devices enabling the dispensing of a measured quantity of content.
Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this place:

Figure 1 illustrates a metering valve, by applying pressure on the valve stem (10a) the valve moves away from its rest position (A) to the actuation position (B) so as to release a measured quantity of material from the metering chamber (2).

Figure 2 illustrates a metering device, by operating handle (9) the operating tube (5) moves downward to allow a measured amount of pressurised aerosol to exit dosing chamber (22). The outflow will stop when piston (26) reaches the underside of cylinder wall (25), and when the handle is released, the piston will be urged downward by spring (27). Dosing chamber (22) will then be refilled with aerosol as a result of the presence of a leak between piston (26) and wall (23).
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Metering in general

definition-item.definition-title: with arrangements for interruption of dispensing when the container is inverted

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:

The Figure illustrates a blocking system comprising a ball (106) and a magnet (157) functioning as follows: when the pressurised container is in the top up position (a), the ball is lodged in the internal space of a recessed element (133). The space between the free face (157d) of the magnet and the free face of the side (133a) of the recessed element (133) is empty. When the user presses on the actuating surface (156) of the pushbutton (154), the valve (104) is actuated.

When the user inverts the container (101) (b) the ball rolls on the side (133b) of the recessed element (133), is attracted by the magnet (157), and is fixed on it by the force of magnetic attraction.

Under these conditions, when the container (101) is in the top-down position (c), the ball (106) fills the space between the magnet (157) and the side (133a) of the recessed element (133). When the user presses on the surface (156) of the pushbutton (154), the pushbutton cannot be depressed, because it is abutting against the ball (106). Consequently, the valve (104) cannot be actuated.

definition-item.definition-title: {with means for preventing delivery (B65D83/56 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this place:

Figure 1 illustrates an aerosol container comprising a solenoid valve (6) which can be remotely controlled by a controller (14). As long as the solenoid valve (6) receives an "OFF" signal, the delivery of content is prevented even if the valve stem (4) is actuated by the push-button (5).

Figure 2 illustrates an aerosol container (11) comprising a security device (17) at the remote end of the dip tube (35) which can be remotely controlled to transition from a first state in which the security device (17) seals intake port (35-2) to a second state in which security device (17) fails to effectively seal intake port (35-2). As long as the security device (17) is in the first state, the delivery of content is prevented even if the valve stem (31) is actuated by the push-button (33).
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Arrangements for interruption of dispensing when the container is inverted

Pressure on the actuating member (22) in a partially raised position will tend to lower it to its flush position with the top panel (24) and thereby will not actuate the dispensing valve. The fact that the actuator in the retracted position is immovable, i.e. locked, is classified in B65D83/22.

definition-item.definition-title: the piston being actuated by a reciprocating axial motion of a shaft which engages the piston, e.g. using a ratchet mechanism

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Pistons being engaged by a shaft having structure, such as ratchet teeth, which is in turn actuated by a reciprocating axial motion, e.g. a push button on the top of the dispensing container.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:

The Figure illustrates actuating steps of the piston having a structure, such as ratchet teeth. The actuator button is depressed, e.g. by a finger, thereby pushing the shaft having ratchet teeth downwards (a). When the shaft is pushed down, the piston is stationary (b). By releasing the actuator button, the ratcheted shaft is pulled upwards, thereby also moving the piston upwards and dispensing the fluent materials (c). The upward movement of the piston being pulled up by the ratchet mechanism is shown in detail in (d).
